intro: Euteline sagittalis, commonly known as the arrowleaf sedge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, grasses, and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Euteline sagittalis typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along stream banks. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
